title: use in test not finding crate
body:
I tried this code using Rust beta (Edition 2021): ```rust use hcaptcha::Hcaptcha; // use hcaptcha_derive::Hcaptcha; #[derive(Hcaptcha)] enum Test { #[captcha] Hcaptcha(String), } fn main() { println!("Super!"); } ``` Which is run by a test run in the `tests` folder: ```rust #[test] fn ui() { let t = trybuild::TestCases::new(); t.compile_fail("tests/ui/*.rs"); } ``` I expected to see this happen: I expected an error message from the derive macro as follows: ```rust error: Must derive on a struct = help: This macro can only be implemented on a struct. #[derive(Hcaptcha)] struct MyStruct { #[captcha] hcaptcha: String, } --> $DIR/not_a_struct.rs:5:6 | 5 | enum Test { | ^^^^ ``` This message is the one generated when the code is compiled as Edition2018 (also Beta channel). Instead, this happened: The 'hcaptcha' crate was not found as a dependency. ```rust error[E0432]: unresolved import `hcaptcha` --> $DIR/not_a_struct.rs:1:5 | 1 | use hcaptcha::Hcaptcha; | ^^^^^^^^ use of undeclared crate or module `hcaptcha` error: cannot determine resolution for the derive macro `Hcaptcha` --> $DIR/not_a_struct.rs:4:10 | 4 | #[derive(Hcaptcha)] | ^^^^^^^^ | = note: import resolution is stuck, try simplifying macro imports error: cannot find attribute `captcha` in this scope --> $DIR/not_a_struct.rs:6:7 | 6 | #[captcha] | ^^^^^^^ ``` I get the same result from the current nighlty build. @dtolnay 's trybuild may be a contributor to this behaviour. The testing process is patterned on that used by the serde project. ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.56.0-beta.3 (deef86610 2021-09-17) binary: rustc commit-hash: deef866109022248b2506587b377c6b1c881d963 commit-date: 2021-09-17 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.56.0-beta.3 LLVM version: 13.0.0 ```
Backtrace

No backtrace generated. ``` ```
